At best it would just be for convenience right?  A way to provide implementors easy access to the context instead of having to take care of passing it around?

fields.description:
https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/8533#issuecomment-717516187

Currently buffers read from files opened by a FileSystem will always be allocated from the default memory pool. This is contrary to the Arrow convention of allowing control over memory allocation.

comments.body: Would it be better to pass it in {{OpenInput(File|Stream)}} or when constructing the filesystem instance?
If you are going to do this, I suggest creating an {{IOContext}} object or similar so that it's easier to add other IO-related options later
That doesn't answer the question I asked above :-)
It seems like at the FileSystem level would be less intrusive
